results.title: Life of the molds
results.brief_description: The microscope reveals the importance of common place moulds in our daily lives, their impact upon history, and some of the beauty and mystery to be found in the study of these tiny plants. Shows the processes of growth and reproduction, and the complex adaptations of moulds to changing environments.

results.title: Life of the grasshopper
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Studies the structure and habits of the grasshopper and discusses its ability to survive. Compares the life cycle of other insects to that of the grasshopper. Shows the grasshopper’s structure and relates it to its ability to survive despite the perils introduced by animals and man. The life cycle of the grasshopper provides a study of incomplete metamorphosis, in contrast with the complete metamorphosis undergone by other insects.

results.title: Life of Galileo
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Peter Couchman and Dr Ray Misson discuss the social and moral questions implied in Bertold Brecht’s play “Life of Galileo”. Shows conflict with the church and the intellectual freedom of the individual. The play also enables Brecht to comment on modern attitudes.

results.title: Life of a queen
results.brief_description: A biography of H.M. Queen Elizabeth II. Scenes of her marriage with H.R.H. Prince Philip, of tours in Commonwealth countries, the varied duties undertaken by Her Majesty in the United Kingdom and sequences showing family life with her husband and three children.

results.title: Life of a primitive people: Africa
results.brief_description: Shows the characteristics of a primitive society, and the interventions and discoveries made by man in prehistoric times. Clarifies the meaning of ‘primitive’ by showing the pattern of life in uncivilized regions of Africa. Shows activities such as weaving and pottery-making embodying thought and skill without technology.

results.title: Life of a Philippine family
results.brief_description: An account of family life in a rural area of the Philippines. The family is that of Carlos, a rice farmer, his wife and two children. Observes Carlos at work in his rice field, his wife shopping and preparing meals for the family, the children as they go to school and assist their parents.

results.title: Life Minus 3
results.brief_description: A film for the layperson on emergency procedures should someone have a sudden heart attack. If the heart stops beating, brain cells will die after three minutes. During this three minute period it is vital that life be prolonged by heart-lung and mouth to mouth resuscitation until expert aid arrives.

results.title: Life is What You Make It
results.brief_description: Bob Bloch and Frank Arndt are both war veterans with very different stories but these men have the same vibrant enthusiasm for life. Bob Bloch ran the Meeniyan Pharmacy for over fifty years while living out his boyhood dream of becoming a pilot and restoring vintage cars. Frank Arndt, while a newcomer to the town, feels he has finally found his rightful place in Meeniyan and is heavily involved in community activities such as contract bridge and table tennis.
